com.yantra.ypm.japi.ue

Interface YPMOverrideGetItemPriceUE


  • public interface YPMOverrideGetItemPriceUE
    User exit to override the output of getItemPrice API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document overrideGetItemPrice(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YPMOverrideGetItemPriceUE user exit is called whenever the getItemPrice API is invoked.

    • Method Detail

      • overrideGetItemPrice

        org.w3c.dom.Document overrideGetItemPrice(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YPMOverrideGetItemPriceUE user exit is called whenever the getItemPrice API is invoked. It is invoked after determining prices for line items passed in the input. The user exit input contains the prices and the price list line based on which the unit price is calculated are populated for the line items which have prices configured. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to override all the calculated pricing information for a line item. If the user exit is overriding any line item then it is expected to return all the line items in the same order as they were passed to the user exit. Overriding any Adjustment element resets that adjustment list, hence all the adjustments should be passed on overriding. The input to YPMOverrideGetItemPriceUE does not include line adjustments in order lines, for getOrderPrice API.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        It is possible to pass extended order header and order line information to the user exit. The extended data can be additional attributes/columns and/or custom hang-off entities. The extended information to pass to the user exit is specified in the user exit template. For example if you have an order header extension like the following:

        createOrder/changeOrder request:
            <Order ...>
              <Extn MyNewColumn="data">
                <ExtnNewHangOff col1="data" col2="data"/>
              </Extn>
              ...
            </Order>

        the extended data can be passed to the user exit by updating the template to include the extended data, e.g:

        user exit template:
            <Order ...>
              <Extn MyNewColumn="">
                <ExtnNewHangOff col1="" col2=""/>
              </Extn>
              ...
            </Order>

        Extended attributes and custom hang-off entities can also be added in the user exit. The newly added extended data will be persisted in the order.

        Additional manual adjustments can be added to the order header and order lines from the user exit. Existing manual adjustments can also be removed from the order header and order lines from the user exit. The ManualAdjustmentOperation attribute of the Adjustment element is used to add or remove a manual adjustment. A child AdjustmentAction element is used to return the ChargeCategory, ChargeName and Reference information. If a new manual adjustment is added that has the same ChargeCategory and ChargeName of an existing manual adjustment, the new manual adjustment will get added to the existing manual adjustment.

        Below are examples for adding and removing manual adjustments to the order header and order lines.

        Example: Adding new manual adjustment to an order line

        <OrderLines>
            <OrderLine ...>
                ...
                <LineAdjustments>
                    <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="ADD" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvaliable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5" AdjustmentPerUnit="-1" ...>
                         <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee1" Reference="Ref1" />
                     </Adjustment>
                 </LineAdjustments>
                ...
            </OrderLine>
        </OrderLines>

        Example: Removing an existing manual adjustment from an order line

        <OrderLines>
            <OrderLine ...>
                ...
                <LineAdjustments>
                    <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="REMOVE" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvaliable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5" AdjustmentPerUnit="-1" ...>
                         <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee1" Reference="Ref1" />
                     </Adjustment>
                 </LineAdjustments>
                ...
            </OrderLine>
        </OrderLines>

        Example: Adding a new manual adjustment to the order header

        <Order>
            ...
            <Adjustments>
                <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="ADD" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvailable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5">
                    <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee" Reference="ref1"/>
                </Adjustment>
            <Adjustments>
            ...
        </Order>

        Example: Removing an existing manual adjustment from the order header

        <Order>
            ...
            <Adjustments>
                <Adjustment ManualAdjustmentOperation="REMOVE" IsManualAdjustment="Y" AdjustmentID="Fee" AdjustmentAvailable="-5" AdjustmentApplied="-5">
                    <AdjustmentAction ChargeCategory="Fees" ChargeName="Fee" Reference="ref1"/>
                </Adjustment>
            <Adjustments>
            ...
        </Order>


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return document should contain XML data as required by the getItemPrice API output. If the user exit is overriding any line item then it is expected to return all the line items in the same order as they were passed to the user exit. Overriding any Adjustment element resets that adjustment list, hence all the adjustments should be passed on overriding.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing XML data as required by the getItemPrice API output. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
